Public Member Functions
fmt::Xml Class Reference

Documentation

This class is used to read values from an XML file. It can also be used to create new XML files, but has limited ability to modify XML files.

This example file is used in the code examples herein.

<gpx
version="1.0"
creator="ExpertGPS 1.1 - http://www.topografix.com"
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xmlns="http://www.topografix.com/GPX/1/0"
xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.topografix.com/GPX/1/0 http://www.topografix.com/GPX/1/0/gpx.xsd">
<time>2002-02-27T17:18:33Z</time>
<bounds minlat="42.401051" minlon="-71.126602" maxlat="42.468655" maxlon="-71.102973"/>
<wpt lat="42.438878" lon="-71.119277">
<ele>44.586548</ele>
<time>2001-11-28T21:05:28Z</time>
<name>5066</name>
<desc><![CDATA[5066]]></desc>
<sym>Crossing</sym>
<type><![CDATA[Crossing]]></type>
</wpt>
<wpt lat="42.439227" lon="-71.119689">
<ele>57.607200</ele>
<time>2001-06-02T03:26:55Z</time>
<name>5067</name>
<desc><![CDATA[5067]]></desc>
<sym>Dot</sym>
<type><![CDATA[Intersection]]></type>
</wpt>
</gpx>

Member Function Documentation

int fmt::Xml::attr ( var::String &  name,
var::String *  value = 0 
)

Get the name of the next attribute.

This method gets the name and value of the next attribute.

StringMedium name;
StringMedium v;
find("gpx.wpt");
attr(name, &v); //name is "lat" and v is "42.438878"

The value(String&, const char*) method can be used to get the value of an attribute directly by name.

StringMedium a;
find("gpx.wpt");
value(a, "(lat)"); //a is now the value of gps.wpt(lat) or "42.438878"
int fmt::Xml::child ( var::String &  name,
var::String *  value = 0 
)

Get the next child.

This method gets the name of the next child

Parameters
namestring reference for name
valuestring pointer for the value

Example:

StringMedium str;
StringMedium v;
find("gpx");
child(str); //str is not "time" cursor points to time object
child(str); //str is now "wpt" cursor points to first wpt object
child(str); //str is now "wpt" cursor points to second wpt object
enter("gpx.wpt[0]"); //cursor points to first wpt object
next_child(str, &v); //str is now ele, v is the value of gps.wpt[0].ele or "44.586548"
int fmt::Xml::close ( )
inlinevirtual

Closes the file or device.

Reimplemented from sys::File.

int fmt::Xml::find ( const char *  str)

Find the element described by str.

This method finds the element described by str. Subsequent calls to sibling(), child(), size(), and value() will only search the element specified.

For example:

StringMedium str;
find("gpx.wpt[0]");
value("ele", str); //copies ele value of gpx.wpt[0] to str
value("(lat)", str); //copies the lat attibute of gpx.wpt[0] to str
Parameters
strThis parameter describes the XML element to find
Returns
Zero on success of -1 if the element was not found
int fmt::Xml::get_value ( var::String &  dest,
const char *  key = 0 
) const

Get the value of the XML element.

The gets the value of an XML element based on the string that describes it.

Parameters
destThe destination string to write the value of the specified attribute
keyThe string describing the element; 0 to get the value of the current element.

The following XML (GPX file) is used as an example.

The following key values will grab the associated strings from the XML file:

  • "gpx(version)" = 1.0
  • "gpx.wpt.ele" = 44.586548
  • "gpx.wpt[0].ele" = 44.586548
  • "gpx.wpt[1].name" = 5067
  • "gpx.wpt[1](lat)" = 42.439227

  • "gpx.time" = 2002-02-27T17:18:33Z

    This values is relative to the current position.

    Returns
    Zero if key is successfully fetched
int fmt::Xml::sibling ( var::String &  dest,
var::String *  value = 0 
)

Get the next sibling.

This method gets the name of the next sibling

Parameters
deststring reference for name
valuestring pointer for the value

Example:

StringMedium str;
StringMedium v;
find("gpx.wpt[0]");
sibling(str); //str is now "wpt" cursor points to time object
sibling(str); //returns -1 because there are no more siblings
int fmt::Xml::size ( ) const
inline

Returns the size of the current object (including tags).

This method returns the size of the current object. It represents the number of bytes in the file
